column4: Ack. Help. I'm going crazy. I need CUDA on a Linux laptop. I bought hardware just for this. This page http://www.nvidia.com/content/cuda/cuda-downloads.html suggests Ubuntu 11.04 is supported... But when I install that, I cannot get online, wired or wireless. So that is no good. 12.04 goes online, but no luck with NVidia drivers...
I don't have a choice if I have to run CUDA software, do I?
Sorry I have no suggestions if those instructions aren't helpful. I'd suggest searching the forums in the meantime until someone here can help.
